name: 奈米科學暨表面物理專題（一）
goals: Enrich students' knowledge in nanoscience and surface physics
Enhance students' understanding of the latest progress in nanoscience and surface physics
Make students aware of the tools, methods and steps of research and problem solving
Improve students' motivation and interest in basic research
syllabus:
Week 1   Introduction to Nano-science

Week 2   Review of solid state physics (I)

Week 3   Review of solid state physics (II)

Week 4   Review of Modern physics (I)

Week 5   Review of Modern physics (II)

Week 6   Introduction to surface physics (I)

Week 7   Introduction to surface physics (II)

Week 8   Magneto-optical Kerr effect (Theory and experimental setup)

Week 9   Ultra-high vacuum system (Theory and experimental setup)

Week 10  Tour to related experimental laboratory

Week 11   Electronic Microscopy (Theory and experimental setup)

Week 12   Electron and X-ray diffraction (Theory and experimental setup)

Week 13   Experimental operation (I) - e-beam heated evaporation

Week 14   Experimental operation (II) – PLD

Week 15   Experimental operation (III) –MOKE

Week 16   Final Oral report

grading.note: This course places great emphasis on participation in class discussions, and students will be graded based on their level of participation in class discussions.
This course places great emphasis on participation in class discussions. Students are not allowed to be absent without an excuse, and class attendance will also count towards the grading.
At the end of the semester, students are required to give a 10-15-minute oral report on selected topics related to nanoscience and surface physics.
